8-Hour Ozone RACT SIP
8-Hour Ozone RACT SIP

RACT = Reasonably Available Control Technology
RACT =
Reasonably Available Control Technology

• Required on existing stationary emission sources
• Required on existing stationary emission sources

in non-attainment areas
in non-attainment areas

• Defined as the lowest emission level a facility is capable of meeting through the application of control technology, considering both technical and economic feasibility
• Defined as the lowest emission level a facility is
capable of meeting through the application of
control technology, considering both technical and
economic feasibility

• States that adopted RACT under 1-hour ozone

8-Hour Ozone RACT SIP
8-Hour Ozone RACT SIP

MassDEP reviewed RACT for two purposes: • To meet EPA’s 8-hour ozone RACT SIP requirement. Required irrespective of whether needed to attain ozone standard • As participant in OTC review of RACT categories to assess tighter RACT within OTC as regional attainment measure.
MassDEP reviewed RACT for two purposes:
• To meet EPA’s 8-hour ozone RACT SIP
requirement. Required irrespective of
whether needed to attain ozone standard
• As participant in OTC review of RACT
categories to assess tighter RACT within
OTC as regional attainment measure.

1-Hour RACT • EPA issued Control Technique Guidelines (CTGs) for 29 source categories of VOC emissions - established a presumptive level of control for RACT
1-Hour RACT
• EPA issued Control Technique Guidelines
(CTGs) for 29 source categories of VOC
emissions - established a presumptive level
of control for RACT

• RACT also required for all major sources of VOCs, whether or not within a CTG source category
• RACT also required for all major sources of
VOCs, whether or not within a CTG source
category

• 1990 Clean Air Act extended RACT to
• 1990 Clean Air Act extended RACT to

major NOx facilities
major NOx facilities

Transport SIP
Transport SIP

SIPs must contain provisions adequate to prohibit
SIPs must contain provisions adequate to prohibit

emissions within a state from:
emissions within a state from:

1.Contributing significantly to nonattainment in
1.Contributing significantly to nonattainment in

another state, or interfering with maintenance of a NAAQS by any other state; or
another state, or interfering with maintenance of a
NAAQS by any other state; or

2. Interfering with another state’s plans to prevent
2. Interfering with another state’s plans to prevent

significant deterioration of air quality or to protect visibility
significant deterioration of air quality or to protect
visibility

Reasonable Further Progress (RFP) SIP
Reasonable Further Progress (RFP) SIP

• Must show 15% reductions from 2002 base
• Must show 15% reductions from 2002 base

year emissions inventory
year emissions inventory

• RFP reductions must be achieved by 2008
• RFP reductions must be achieved by 2008

(6 years after base year)
(6 years after base year)

• May be 15% VOC or 15% NOx or a
• May be 15% VOC or 15% NOx or a

combination of both
combination of both

RFP SIP
RFP SIP

• 2008 projected emissions derived by
• 2008 projected emissions derived by

applying growth factors to the 2002 base year emissions inventory
applying growth factors to the 2002 base
year emissions inventory

• 2008 projected emissions must be less than
• 2008 projected emissions must be less than

or equal to the target levels
or equal to the target levels

• Preliminary calculations show MA to be
• Preliminary calculations show MA to be

well within RFP targets
well within RFP targets
